did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: John W. Spencer Nature Study papers, 1897-1912.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence about nature study leaflets, agricultural problems, including some with members of the state legislature and some personal correspondence.
Also, an engraved silver goblet given to Mr. and Mrs. John Walton Spencer, June 11-12, 1912.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Deputy Chief of Extension Work, Cornell University.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence about nature study leaflets, agricultural problems, including some with members of the state legislature and some personal correspondence.
Also, an engraved silver goblet given to Mr. and Mrs. John Walton Spencer, June 11-12, 1912.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.persname: Comstock, J. Henry (John Henry), 1849-1931 LH Bailey

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: John W. Spencer Papers, #21-24-238. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence sent to John W. Spencer, primarily requesting Nature Leaflet reports, from schoolchildren, teachers and other educators. A small number of letters are more personal in nature.
Includes letter inquiring whether John Spencer is related to other Spencers in the state; also a letter from his cousin Edgar A. Spencer.
Includes letter describing the plight of farmers in society (Jan 28).
Includes letters from Anna Comstock, J. H. Comstock, Martha Van Rensselaer.
Includes letter from Martha Van Rensselaer
Includes letter from Anna Comstock
Includes letter signed "Comstock", probably J.H.
Includes letter from a teacher (Jackson) at Tuskagee Normal and Industrial Institute during the period when Booker T. Washington was Principal.
Includes telegram from Albany, "Bill signed today" re: Nixon Bill.
Includes letter from his Cousin; Includes letter from Martha Van Renssalaer
Includes passenger list for American Line sailing from NY to Southampton, with LH Bailey listed as passenger.
Includes brief letter from LH Bailey in Strasbourg regarding edits to manuscript.
Includes letter from G. W. Carver when Director of Tuskagee Normal and Industrial Institute
Includes letter from Martha Van Rensselaer
Includes Spencer's response to earlier letter regarding family geneaology (in 1-12)
Includes letter from Martha Van Rensselaer
Includes responsefrom a teacher (Jackson) at Tuskagee Normal and Industrial Institute during the period when Booker T. Washington was Principal.
Includes a letter from his cousin.

Includes letter from a colleague in Paris commenting on the French army; includes composition by an 18 yr old still in school entitled "The Future", commenting on many new inventions, the Spanish-Ameriacn war and imagining the future.
Includes letter from cousin Edgar Spencer.
Includes letter from cousin Edgar Spencer.
Includes clipping from "Primary Education" journal about the Bureau of Nature Study".
Includes a request on postcard for nature leaflets from a teacher in Russia.
Includes letter from Alice Donlevy, Ladies Art Association of NY, with comments on the usefulness of various leaflets.
Includes letter from Martha Van Rensselaer.
Includes letter from Martha Van Rensselaer.
Includes letter from Anna Comstock about manuscript for chicken leaflet
Includes letter from Martha Van Rensselaer.
Includes letter from Ernest Ingersoll.
Includes letter from Martha Van Rensselaer.
Includes letter from Martha Van Rensselaer.
Includes a letter discussing photography
